required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Double-blind Extension of HORIZON Pivotal Fracture Trial (Zoledronic Acid in the Treatment of Postmenopausal Osteoporosis)
clinical_study.official_title: A 3-year, Double-blind Extension to CZOL446H2301 to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Zoledronic Acid in the Treatment of Osteoporosis in Postmenopausal Women Taking Calcium and Vitamin D

brief_summary.textblock: This extension study is designed to assess the long term safety and efficacy of zoledronic acid in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis who have participated in the CZOL446H2301 (NCT00049829): HORIZON Pivotal Fracture Trial. This extension study began after the 3-year core study ended. Baseline is the same as Year 3.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Femoral Neck at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6 (Month 72; end of extension study)
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy variable was the percentage change in BMD of the femoral neck as measured by dual x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 *(femoral neck BMD at Year 6 − femoral neck BMD at Year 3) / (femoral neck BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Resorption and Formation Biochemical Markers at Year 4.5: P1NP
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of serum n-terminal propeptide of type I collagen (P1NP) as determined by the central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Resorption and Formation Biochemical Markers at Year 6: P1NP
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of serum P1NP as determined by the central laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Lumbar Spine at Year 4.5 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 4.5 (Month 54)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at Year 4.5 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 4.5 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Lumbar Spine at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 6 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Distal Radius at Year 4.5 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 4.5 (Month 54)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at Year 4.5 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 4.5 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Distal Radius at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6 (Month 72)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 6 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Femoral Neck, Total Hip and Trochanter at Year 4.5 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 4.5 (Month 54)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at 4.5 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 4.5 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in BMD of Femoral Neck, Total Hip and Trochanter at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6 (Month 72)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage change in BMD as measured by DXA at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 * (BMD at Year 6 - BMD at Year 3)/(BMD at Year 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With New and New/Worsening Morphometric Vertebral Fractures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Lateral vertebral x-rays were performed at the final core study visit and at Year 6 and read by a central expert reader at a central imaging laboratory to assess for new or new/worsening morphometric vertebral fracture. The percentage of patients with new morphometric vertebral fractures (observed for the first time) and patients with either new or worsening morphometric vertebral fractures was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of Clinical Fracture
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical fracture excludes finger, toe, and facial bone fractures. Clinical vertebral fracture includes thoracic spine fracture and lumbar spine fracture. Non-vertebral fracture excludes clinical vertebral, finger, toe, and facial bone fractures.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Study Visit at Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Unpaired transiliac crest bone biopsy was performed for histomorphometry, which was obtained after double tetracycline labeling. No data were collected for Patients who received Placebo for the first 3 years of the study (Placebo 3 Zoledronic Acid 3).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 9-11 Days Post Year 3 Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Extension Baseline (Year 3; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) to 9-11 days after the Year 3 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine measurements performed by a central laboratory was used to evaluate acute changes in renal function 9-11 days after study drug infusion in Z6 patients compared to Z3P3 patients and in P3Z3 patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 9-11 Days Post Year 4 Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Extension Baseline (Year 3; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) to 9-11 days after the Year 4 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine measurements performed by a central laboratory was used to evaluate acute changes in renal function 9-11 days after Year 4 study drug infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 9-11 Days Post Year 5 Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Extension Baseline (Year 3; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) to 9-11 days after the Year 5 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Serum creatinine measurements performed by a central laboratory was used to evaluate acute changes in renal function 9-11 days after Year 5 study drug infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Laboratory Parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Extension Baseline (Year 3; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) to Year 6
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the laboratory key profile such as Calcium, Creatinine and Urea. The number of patients with clinically significant calcium, creatinine and urea were reported.

arm_group.description: Patients who received Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study (CZOL446H2301; NCT00049829) received a single intravenous infusion of 5 mg Zoledronic acid once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study for a total of 6 years of treatment.
Patients who were treated with Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study received a single intravenous matching Placebo infusion once a year for 3 years in this extension study.

Patients who were treated with placebo for 3 years in the core study received 5 mg Zoledronic acid in a single intravenous infusion once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study.

intervention.description: Zoledronic Acid 5 mg in 100 mL physiologic 0.9% normal saline for intravenous infusion.
100 mL physiologic 0.9% normal saline for intravenous infusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have received 3 infusions in the HORIZON-Pivotal Fracture (PFT) Study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor kidney, eye, or liver health
- Use of certain therapies for osteoporosis in the HORIZON-PFT study (other than the study medication)
- Abnormal calcium levels in the blood
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: University of Arkansas for Medical Science
Northwestern University Center for Clinical Research
Maine Center for Osteoporosis Research and Education
Washington University Center for Clinical Studies
New Mexico Clinical Research and Osteoporosis Center Inc
University of Cincinnati Bone Health and Osteoporosis Center
Rhode Island Hospital, Endocrinology Clinical Research Unit

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was an international, multicenter, randomized, double-blind 3-year extension study in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis who had completed participation in the CZOL446H2301 (NCT00049829) core study. The extension study started 17 May 2005 (First patient enrolled) and ended 24 Nov 2009 (Last patient completed).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients who were receiving zoledronic acid in the core study were randomized in a 1:1 fashion to receive either zoledronic acid or placebo in the extension study. Patients who were receiving placebo in the core study were assigned to zoledronic acid in the extension study in order to retain the core study blind.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 6
group.description: Patients who received Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study (CZOL446H2301; NCT00049829) received a single intravenous infusion of 5 mg Zoledronic acid once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study for a total of 6 years of treatment.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 3 Placebo 3
group.description: Patients who were treated with Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study received a single intravenous matching Placebo infusion once a year for 3 years in this extension study.

group.title: Placebo 3 Zoledronic Acid 3
group.description: Patients who were treated with placebo for 3 years in the core study received 5 mg Zoledronic acid in a single intravenous infusion once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study.

participants_list.participants: Group Z6 and Group Z3P3 have randomized participants.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage Change in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Femoral Neck at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
outcome.description: The primary efficacy variable was the percentage change in BMD of the femoral neck as measured by dual x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 *(femoral neck BMD at Year 6 − femoral neck BMD at Year 3) / (femoral neck BMD at Year 3).
outcome.time_frame: Year 3 (Extension Baseline; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) and Year 6 (Month 72; end of extension study)
outcome.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population. The MITT population included all patients in the ITT population who had DXA measurements of the femoral neck at Year 3 and Year 6. This was the primary population for primary efficacy parameter.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 6
group.description: Patients who received Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study (CZOL446H2301; NCT00049829) received a single intravenous infusion of 5 mg Zoledronic acid once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study for a total of 6 years of treatment.

measure.title: Percentage Change in Bone Mineral Density (BMD) of Femoral Neck at Year 6 Relative to Year 3
measure.description: The primary efficacy variable was the percentage change in BMD of the femoral neck as measured by dual x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at Year 6 relative to Year 3. It was derived as 100 *(femoral neck BMD at Year 6 − femoral neck BMD at Year 3) / (femoral neck BMD at Year 3).
measure.population: Modified intent-to-treat (MITT) population. The MITT population included all patients in the ITT population who had DXA measurements of the femoral neck at Year 3 and Year 6. This was the primary population for primary efficacy parameter.

outcome.title: Bone Resorption and Formation Biochemical Markers at Year 4.5: P1NP
outcome.description: The amount of serum n-terminal propeptide of type I collagen (P1NP) as determined by the central laboratory.
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population included all patients who were randomized or enrolled in the extension study at Visit 8. The number of patients analyzed = the number of patients with measurements at Year 4.5 as determined by the analysis window.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Incidence of Clinical Fracture
outcome.description: Clinical fracture excludes finger, toe, and facial bone fractures. Clinical vertebral fracture includes thoracic spine fracture and lumbar spine fracture. Non-vertebral fracture excludes clinical vertebral, finger, toe, and facial bone fractures.
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population included all patients who were randomized or enrolled in the extension study at Visit 8. n = the number of patients with measurements at Year 6 as determined by the analysis window.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 6
group.description: Patients who received Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study (CZOL446H2301; NCT00049829) received a single intravenous infusion of 5 mg Zoledronic acid once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study for a total of 6 years of treatment.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 3 Placebo 3
group.description: Patients who were treated with Zoledronic acid for 3 years in the core study received a single intravenous matching Placebo infusion once a year for 3 years in this extension study.

group.title: Placebo 3 Zoledronic Acid 3
group.description: Patients who were treated with placebo for 3 years in the core study received 5 mg Zoledronic acid in a single intravenous infusion once a year for 3 years (at Months 36, 48 and 60) in this extension study.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Incidence of Clinical Fracture
measure.description: Clinical fracture excludes finger, toe, and facial bone fractures. Clinical vertebral fracture includes thoracic spine fracture and lumbar spine fracture. Non-vertebral fracture excludes clinical vertebral, finger, toe, and facial bone fractures.
measure.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population included all patients who were randomized or enrolled in the extension study at Visit 8. n = the number of patients with measurements at Year 6 as determined by the analysis window.

outcome.title: Qualitative Bone Biopsy Parameters
outcome.description: Unpaired transiliac crest bone biopsy was performed for histomorphometry, which was obtained after double tetracycline labeling. No data were collected for Patients who received Placebo for the first 3 years of the study (Placebo 3 Zoledronic Acid 3).
outcome.time_frame: End of Study Visit at Year 6

outcome.title: Change in Serum Creatinine From Baseline to 9-11 Days Post Year 3 Infusion
outcome.description: Serum creatinine measurements performed by a central laboratory was used to evaluate acute changes in renal function 9-11 days after study drug infusion in Z6 patients compared to Z3P3 patients and in P3Z3 patients.
outcome.time_frame: Extension Baseline (Year 3; Month 36 prior to the first treatment of the extension study) to 9-11 days after the Year 3 infusion
outcome.population: Safety Population included all patients in the ITT population who received at least one dose of study drug during the extension study.

outcome.title: The Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Laboratory Parameters

Anxiety disorder due to a general medical condition

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
